fields.text: Fear Him whom you do not know.
fields.author: Ali ibn Abi Talib

fields.text: Kindness is a mark of faith.
fields.author: Prophet Muhammad (PBUH)

fields.text: Patience is the key to paradise.
fields.author: Prophet Muhammad (PBUH)

fields.text: Allah is with the patient.
fields.author: Quran (2:153)

fields.text: Speak good or remain silent.
fields.author: Prophet Muhammad (PBUH)

fields.text: To forgive is the best revenge.
fields.author: Ali ibn Abi Talib

fields.text: Do good and good will come to you.
fields.author: Prophet Muhammad (PBUH)

fields.text: The best of you are those who are best to their families.
fields.author: Prophet Muhammad (PBUH)

fields.text: Allah is the best of planners.
fields.author: Quran (8:30)

fields.text: The greatest jihad is to battle your own soul, to fight the evil within yourself.
fields.author: Prophet Muhammad (PBUH)

fields.text: Do not be a slave to others when Allah has created you free.
fields.author: Ali ibn Abi Talib

fields.text: The ink of the scholar is more sacred than the blood of the martyr.
fields.author: Prophet Muhammad (PBUH)

fields.text: When you have nothing left except Allah, then you find that Allah is always enough for you.
fields.author: Ibn Qayyim

fields.text: The most complete gift of God is a life based on knowledge.
fields.author: Ali ibn Abi Talib

fields.text: The one who disdains forgiveness is the one who disregards the value of goodness and gratitude.
fields.author: Ali ibn Abi Talib

fields.text: Speak the truth even if it is against yourself.
fields.author: Ali ibn Abi Talib

fields.text: He who does not have forbearance, has nothing.
fields.author: Umar ibn Al-Khattab

fields.text: Do not belittle any good deed, even meeting your brother with a cheerful face.
fields.author: Prophet Muhammad (PBUH)

fields.text: Kindness is a mark of faith.
fields.author: Prophet Muhammad (PBUH)

fields.text: Do not be people without minds of your own.
fields.author: Prophet Muhammad (PBUH)

fields.text: The best of you are those who are best to their families.
fields.author: Prophet Muhammad (PBUH)

fields.text: For indeed, with hardship [will be] ease.
fields.author: Quran 94:6

fields.text: And He is with you wherever you are.
fields.author: Quran 57:4

fields.text: And He found you lost and guided [you].
fields.author: Quran 93:7

fields.text: And He is the Forgiving, the Affectionate.
fields.author: Quran 85:14

fields.text: So remember Me; I will remember you.
fields.author: Quran 2:152

fields.text: Seek knowledge from the cradle to the grave.
fields.author: Prophet Muhammad (PBUH)

fields.text: A fool’s mind is at the mercy of his tongue and a wise man’s tongue is under the control of his mind.
fields.author: Imam Ali

fields.text: The best way to defeat someone is to beat him at politeness.
fields.author: Imam Ali

fields.text: Acquire knowledge and teach it to the people. Learn dignity and tranquility.
fields.author: Umar ibn Al-Khattab

fields.text: A person who never made a mistake never tried anything new.
fields.author: Imam Shafi'i

fields.text: Knowledge without action is insanity, and action without knowledge is vanity.
fields.author: Imam Abu Hanifa

fields.text: He who does not have forbearance, has nothing.
fields.author: Imam Shafi'i

fields.text: Sincerity is to forget about the audience, the witness, and the public; it is to forget about everyone, but the One to Whom the deeds are dedicated.
fields.author: Imam Hanbali

fields.text: He who studies jurisprudence with an innovator will leave the world with a heretical outlook.
fields.author: Imam Maliki

fields.text: Acquire knowledge and teach it to the people. Learn dignity and tranquility.
fields.author: Imam Hanafi
